instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.CPUVR_PGOOD: What is CPUVR_PGOOD? CPU_VR_PGOOD Is a signal present when CPU_VR_EN is presenT. CPU_VR_PGOOD is a prerequisite along with ALL_SYS_PWRGD to create PM_S0_PGOOD and PM_PCH_PWROK and PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK which are necessary for the machine to turn on and boot..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> NO POWER
threads.message:
Hello got this macbook with <SIGNAL>VR0V9_IND_TBT_X</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>VR0V9_IND_TBT_X</SIGNAL> full short to ground, fan spins high
but no brain. no display no usb activity.
after removing <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> is removed. short circiruit is gone.
i took <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> from <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> donor board and put properly the macbook still cant on
no fan spin no usb activity.
ppbus 13v
usb meter 20v 0.96-1.15amp looping.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> NO POWER
threads.message:
Do you get CPU core voltage?
Did you test the board without <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> soldered?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> NO POWER
threads.message:
<CHIP>U2800</CHIP> removed
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 0V 0.008 diode to ground.
CPU issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> NO POWER
threads.message:
CPU core rail has low value as normal.

Do you get voltage on other big coils?
Check pages 73/5/6.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> NO POWER
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> NO POWER
threads.message:
So you have missing <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>.
Check the power good signals at <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> (1 OF 10), at page 74.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> NO POWER
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>CPUVR_PGOOD</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>P5VS4_PGOOD</SIGNAL> 3.0v
<SIGNAL>P1VSUS_PGOOD</SIGNAL> 3.3V
<SIGNAL>P1V0PCH_PGOOD</SIGNAL> 3.3V
<SIGNAL>P1V8SUS_PGOOD</SIGNAL> 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PVCCIO_PGOOD</SIGNAL> 3.3V
<SIGNAL>P3V3SUS_PGOOD</SIGNAL> cant find testpoint  
cant see what else to check

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> NO POWER
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>CPUVR_PGOOD</SIGNAL> 3.3v"
This implies correct CPU core voltage; impossible without <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>!!!

PLEASE, post accurate information.
